Title.evidence: Title: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Lobar and Sublobar Resection in Peripheral cT1aN0 NSCLC

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to LR (357) or sublobar resection (SLR) (340)

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to LR (357) or sublobar resection (SLR) (340)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was DFS over five years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 697 patients were enrolled between June 2007 and March 2017.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 362 patients underwent LR, 131 SR, and 204 WR.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Five-year DFS was 64.7% for LR, 63.8% for SR, and 62.5% for WR (p = 0.888).
